page.title: 05GRETTON BAPTIST CHURCH
page.content: There has been a Baptist meeting place in Gretton since 1786. Originally people had to walk from Gretton to the Fuller Baptist Church in Kettering, a distance of 13 miles. Some walked even further from places like Uppingham. The first chapel which was built in Gretton was called the Church of Christ. In 1825 a building in the High Street was licensed for worship, which brought all the people from neighbouring places to Gretton. A Sunday School was started in 1842 with three meetings during the day; now there is one. Unlike the Parish Church, there is no altar. The Baptist Minister lives in a large house, situated next to the Chapel, called "The Manse".
